greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to express 2/n as Egyptian fractions in just three terms; i.e., 2/n = 1/x + 1/y + 1/z satisfying 1<=x<=y<=z.
link: Daniel Leary, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for sequences related to Egyptian fractions
mathematica: a[n_] := Length@ Solve[ 2/n == 1/x + 1/y + 1/z && 1 <= x <= y <= z, {x, y, z}, Integers]; Array[a, 70]
xref: See A073101 for the 4/n conjecture due to Erdős and Straus.
results.author: _Allan C. Wechsler_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 17 2013
